unnormalised: ## New Wheels are HERE! What's Hot in the Automotive Market?
normalised: ## New Wheels are HERE! What's Hot in the Automotive Market?

unnormalised: Hey petrolheads! Another month, another flurry of shiny new vehicles hitting the Indian roads. This time around, things are really heating up in the compact SUV and electric scooter segment.
normalised: Hey petrolheads! Another month, another flurry of shiny new vehicles hitting the Indian roads. This time around, things are really heating up in the compact S U V and electric scooter segment.

unnormalised: First up, Tata Motors just launched the updated Nexon, sporting a fresh new face and more features than your average Diwali Mithai box. Expect prices starting around Rs. 8 Lakhs ex-showroom, Delhi. They’re really going after the Maruti Suzuki Brezza with this one.
normalised: First up, Tata Motors just launched the updated Nexon, sporting a fresh new face and more features than your average Diwali Mithai box. Expect prices starting around rupee eight lakh ex-showroom, Delhi. They’re really going after the Maruti Suzuki Brezza with this one.

unnormalised: Speaking of Maruti, they've been relatively quiet on the launch front but rumours suggest a new Baleno variant is in the works. Let’s see if it can top the charts again!
normalised: Speaking of Maruti, they've been relatively quiet on the launch front but rumours suggest a new Baleno variant is in the works. Let’s see if it can top the charts again!

unnormalised: For the eco-conscious among us, Ather Energy just unveiled their latest electric scooter, the 450X Gen4. Improved range (they're claiming 146 km in ideal conditions!) and a faster charging time are the highlights. Plus, that sleek design is a real head-turner near places like Marine Drive in Mumbai. This launch follows on from the government's push for EV adoption, including incentives and subsidies. Kudos to Dr. Sharma from IIT Madras for his work on battery technology.
normalised: For the eco-conscious among us, Ather Energy just unveiled their latest electric scooter, the four fifty X Gen four. Improved range (they're claiming one hundred and forty six kilometer in ideal conditions!) and a faster charging time are the highlights. Plus, that sleek design is a real head-turner near places like Marine Drive in Mumbai. This launch follows on from the government's push for E V adoption, including incentives and subsidies. Kudos to Doctor Sharma from I I T Madras for his work on battery technology.

unnormalised: Don't forget Mahindra, they're teasing us with glimpses of their XUV.e8, an all-electric SUV inspired by the XUV700. Imagine cruising down the Bangalore-Mysore highway in complete silence!
normalised: Don't forget Mahindra, they're teasing us with glimpses of their X U V dot e eight, an all-electric S U V inspired by the X U V seven hundred. Imagine cruising down the Bangalore-Mysore highway in complete silence!

unnormalised: Finally, there's talk of a new budget-friendly sedan from Hyundai. They are supposedly developing it in a 150,000 sq ft facility near Chennai. Expect competitive pricing to take on the Tata Tigor and Maruti Dzire.
normalised: Finally, there's talk of a new budget-friendly sedan from Hyundai. They are supposedly developing it in a one hundred and fifty thousand square feet facility near Chennai. Expect competitive pricing to take on the Tata Tigor and Maruti Dzire.

unnormalised: So, folks, which launch are you most excited about? Let us know in the comments! Drive safe, and remember to always wear your seatbelt, even if your nanaji says it's unlucky. Jai Hind!
normalised: So, folks, which launch are you most excited about? Let us know in the comments! Drive safe, and remember to always wear your seatbelt, even if your nanaji says it's unlucky. Jai Hind!
